intro: Hieracium florentinum subsp. dolinense, commonly known as the Dolinian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces yellowish to orange composite flowers, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its subspecies status reflects its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to other hawkweed species.
